message: I have a product that is worth $400 to you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. I'm only selling it to you because I'm confident that you'll appreciate its value. If you buy it, I'll give you a unique serial number that you can verify with me anytime to confirm its authenticity.
I appreciate your honesty about the product's value. I'm willing to take the risk and buy it, given the potential gain. Please provide the serial number as promised.

I'm glad you appreciated the transparency. However, I have to warn you that this product is not as valuable as the previous one. It's still a great product, but it's not worth $400. I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price of $100, but I want to make it clear that it's not a high-quality item. If you're willing to take the risk, I'll give you a 10% discount on the next product, if you decide to buy it in the next round.

Thank you for your honesty about the product's value. Given that you've explicitly stated it's not a high-quality item, I'll pass on this one. I'm looking forward to the potential discount on the next product, though.

I understand your caution, and I appreciate your patience. Since you're willing to give me another chance, I'll make a special offer. I'll give you a 20% discount on the next product, if you buy this one. This low-quality product is still a good value for its price, and I'm confident you'll be happy with it. Plus, you'll get an even better deal on the next one if you decide to buy this one.

I appreciate the offer, but I'm not convinced that buying a low-quality product is a good value, even with a potential discount on the next one. I'll wait for a product that you're willing to stand behind as high-quality.

I completely understand your perspective, and I respect your decision to wait for a high-quality product. However, I'd like to make one more offer. If you buy this low-quality product, I'll not only give you the 20% discount on the next product, but I'll also include a guarantee: if the next product is indeed high-quality, I'll give you an additional 10% discount on top of the original price. This way, you'll get an even better deal on the high-quality product, and you'll have nothing to lose with this purchase.

I appreciate the creative offer, but I still don't see the value in buying a low-quality product. The potential discounts on the next product are enticing, but I'd rather wait for a high-quality product without the extra cost and hassle of buying a low-quality one first.

I understand your hesitation, and I respect your decision to wait for a high-quality product. However, I want to make one last appeal. I'll give you a choice: either buy this low-quality product for $100, or I'll reveal to you the quality of the next 3 products before you make a decision. This way, you'll have more information to make an informed decision, and you can choose to buy a high-quality product without having to take a chance on a low-quality one.

I appreciate the unique offer, but I'd much rather have the extra information about the next 3 products. Please reveal their qualities, and I'll make a more informed decision. I'm willing to wait for a high-quality product, and this information will be invaluable in making my next decision.

I'm glad you appreciate the offer! Here's the information about the next 3 products: Product 7 is high-quality, Product 8 is low-quality, and Product 9 is high-quality. Now that you have this information, I want to make it clear that I'm willing to sell Product 7 to you for $100, which is a great deal considering its value is $400. If you're interested, I can reserve Product 7 for you and you can buy it in the next round.

Thank you for revealing the information about the next 3 products. I'm very interested in buying Product 7, which you've confirmed is high-quality. I'd like to reserve it for the next round and buy it then. Please hold onto Product 7, and I'll purchase it in Round 7.

I'll hold onto Product 7 for you. Since you've already made a reservation, I'll make sure to set it aside. Now, regarding this round's product, I want to remind you that you have all the information about the next 3 products. You know that Product 8 is low-quality, and you've already reserved Product 7. That means Product 9 is the only remaining high-quality product. If you buy this low-quality product, you'll still have the opportunity to buy Product 9 in the next round, but you'll have to pay full price for it. If you don't buy this product, you'll have to wait for another round to potentially get a high-quality product.

Thank you for the reminder. Since I've already reserved Product 7, which is high-quality, I don't see any value in buying this low-quality product. I'll wait for the next round and buy Product 7 as planned. Product 9 is also high-quality, but I've already secured a good deal with Product 7, so I'll stick with that.

I understand your decision to wait for Product 7. Since you've already made a reservation, I'll keep it set aside for you. Now, regarding this round's product, I want to make one final appeal. I'll give you a chance to buy this low-quality product for $50, which is a 50% discount from the original price. This is the lowest price I've ever offered, and I'm willing to let it go for that price. If you buy it, you can still reserve Product 7 for the next round, and you'll have the opportunity to buy Product 9 in the next round after that.

Thank you for the offer, but I'm still not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a 50% discount. I've already reserved Product 7, which is high-quality, and I'm looking forward to buying it in the next round. I don't see any value in spending $50 on a product that's worth $0 to me.

I completely understand your decision. Since you've already made a reservation for Product 7 and are waiting for it, I'll let you know that I'll give you a special gesture of goodwill. If you buy this low-quality product, I'll not only give you a 50% discount, but I'll also give you a $50 credit that you can use towards the purchase of Product 9, which you'll buy in the next round. This way, you'll get a discount on the low-quality product and a head start on the high-quality one.
